title: New aluminium projects in Indonesia ramp up, boosting daily average aluminium production outside China
summary: Overseas aluminium production increased 2.2% year-over-year in December 2025, with cumulative 2025 production up 2.8% YoY. New Indonesian aluminium projects in ramp-up stage diluted overall operating rates to 87.7%, while energy challenges threaten smelters in Australia (Tomago) and Mozambique (Mozal), with Mozal scheduled for maintenance shutdown around March 15, 2026 due to power supply disagreements.

title: New Aluminum Projects in Indonesia Ramp Up, Boosting Daily Average Aluminum Production Outside China
summary: Overseas aluminum production in December 2025 rose 2.2% year-over-year with an average monthly operating rate of 87.7%, primarily impacted by new Indonesian projects still in commissioning phase. Energy supply agreements remain critical concerns for major smelters, with Tomago securing long-term energy arrangements and Mozal facing shutdown due to power supply negotiations.

title: Aluminum Rises to 3½-Year Highs
summary: Aluminum futures reached $2,970 per tonne, the highest since May 2022, driven by supply constraints including South32's Mozal smelter shutdown announcement and equipment failures at Iceland's Grundartangi smelter. Global aluminum prices have risen approximately 17% year-to-date amid tight supply conditions and China's approach to its 45-million-ton annual output cap.

title: ABB identifies shift to secondary aluminum and digitalization as major trends in aluminum sector in 2025 and beyond
summary: ABB highlights the shift to recycled secondary aluminum production from scrap metal, which can save up to 95% CO2 emissions compared to primary aluminum, as a key trend for decarbonization. Digital technologies like IIoT sensors enable real-time monitoring to boost quality, reduce waste, and address skills shortages. These innovations support meeting rising global demand projected to increase 40% by 2030 while enhancing sustainability.

title: Aluminum Market Report 2025: Business Expansion, Key Growth
summary: Technological innovations in aluminum production, such as advanced smelting with inert anode technology and high-efficiency electrolytic cells, reduce energy use and carbon emissions. Improvements in recycling technologies support high-quality recovery, aligning with sustainability and circular economy goals. Demand surges from transportation, especially electric vehicles, and construction drive market growth despite competition from substitutes.

title: AKFA Aluminum to Build First U.S. Facility in Kentucky
summary: AKFA Aluminum invests $80 million in a new Kentucky facility using recycled aluminum billets and energy-efficient equipment for lower-carbon production. The plant will produce aluminum extrusions, anodizing, and finishing for construction, transportation, and renewable energy markets, creating 331 jobs. This expands sustainable U.S. manufacturing and strengthens trade ties with Uzbekistan.

title: EGA Launches Expanded Aluminium Recycling Operations in the U.S. as Global Growth Accelerates
summary: Emirates Global Aluminium (EGA) starts production at its expanded EGA Spectro Alloys plant in Minnesota, increasing recycling capacity. This meets rising global demand for low-carbon recycled aluminum. The expansion advances sustainability through greater use of recycled content in aluminum production.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel fell to 936 USD/T on December 30, 2025, down 0.21% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 3.65%, and are up 32.02% compared to the same time last year. Forecasts indicate trading at 906.95 USD/T by quarter-end and 994.97 USD/T in 12 months.

title: Steel stocks up 2nd straight day, rally up to 5%; SAIL, JSL hit 52-wk highs
summary: Share prices of steel companies rallied up to 5% for the second straight day amid government notification of anti-dumping and safeguard duties on flat steel imports for three years. Leading Indian steelmakers hiked domestic HRC and CRC prices by ₹750/tonne on December 30, 2025, to ~₹49,800/ton and ~₹56,400/ton respectively, with further hikes planned for early January 2026. Prices reflect higher raw material costs, moderate inventories, and recovering demand despite prior corrections from May 2025 highs.

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 31.12.2025
summary: SteelRadar provides daily updates on global iron and steel prices, including Shanghai Futures Rebar terms unchanged on December 30, 2025, and various 1- and 2-month futures for Turkey, China, Europe, and North America as of December 29, 2025. The platform covers indices, prices, and news for rebar, scrap, and iron/steel markets. No specific price changes noted in the latest snapshot.

title: US tariff policy affects Japanese steel industry – JISF
summary: US tariff policy is impacting the Japanese steel industry, as reported by JISF on December 30, 2025. Other recent notes include 8% growth in Indian steel demand for FY2025/26. The site aggregates steel market news on prices and trends.

title: Delayed publication of Turkey flat steel prices: pricing notice
summary: Publication of Fastmarkets' Turkey flat steel prices for December 29, 2025, was delayed due to a reporter error and updated the following day. Affected prices include HRC import CFR Turkey, CRC import, HRC export FOB, domestic exw prices for HRC, CRC, HDG, PPGI, and slab import CFR Turkey. Contact details provided for feedback or data submission.

title: US raw steel production is down 1.7 percent - week 53, 2025
summary: US domestic raw steel production for the week ending December 27, 2025, was 1.695 million net tons with a capacity utilization rate of 74.0%, down 1.7% from the previous week. Year-to-date production through December 27, 2025, reached 89.301 million net tons at 76.7% capacity utilization, representing a 3.4% increase compared to the same period in 2024.

title: World crude steel production for November 2025
summary: Global crude steel production for 70 countries reporting to worldsteel was 140.1 million tonnes in November 2025, representing a 4.6% decrease compared to November 2024. This data reflects recent trends in worldwide steel production capacity and output.

title: Nucor Announces Guidance for the Fourth Quarter of 2025 Earnings
summary: Nucor's steel mills segment earnings are projected to decrease in Q4 2025 due to lower volumes and margin compression, particularly in sheet steel production. The guidance reflects challenging market conditions affecting major US steel producers.

title: BHP POSCO Partner on Near Zero Emissions Steel Technology
summary: BHP and POSCO are partnering on HyREX hydrogen steelmaking technology at a new 300,000-tonne plant to achieve near-zero emissions steel production. This innovation addresses the steel industry's high carbon footprint of 2.3 tons of CO2 per ton of steel by replacing coal-dependent processes with hydrogen-based reduction. The initiative supports BHP's 2050 net-zero emissions target and could transform global supply chains in construction and automotive sectors.

title: Comex Copper Settles 3.99% Higher at $5.7275 — Data Talk
summary: Front Month Comex Copper for January delivery rose 21.95 cents per pound, or 3.99%, to settle at $5.7275, marking the fifth highest close in history. The price is up seven of the past nine sessions, 43.69% from its 52-week low, and 10.45% month-to-date. It remains off 1.16% from its record high of $5.795 hit on July 23, 2025.

title: Top Headlines Of 1:00 | Copper At Record $13,000 On Supply Fears
summary: Copper prices surged to a record $13,000 per tonne amid intensifying global supply concerns from mine disruptions, with the rally likely to continue into 2026. The sharp rise is driven by tightening supplies, delays in mining projects, and rising demand from clean energy, EVs, and infrastructure. Trading resumed with a 6.6% surge to $12,960 on the London Metal Exchange.

title: Copper Price Nears $13,000 as Supply Strain and Trade Policy Drive Volatility
summary: Copper prices surged toward $13,000 a tonne on Monday, up as much as 6.6% intraday before paring gains, driven by supply disruptions, US tariff speculation, and strong demand from energy transition and AI. Mine outages in Chile, Indonesia, and Peru, combined with policy uncertainty, are fueling volatility and investor enthusiasm. Analysts forecast deepening deficits, with demand potentially tripling by 2045.

title: Copper on fire: Why prices are at record highs and what's next
summary: Copper prices hit record highs in late 2025 due to US Federal Reserve easing, trade policy arbitrage, supply disruptions, and surging demand from electrification, AI, and India's imports. The rally has created a persistent market deficit expected to continue. Robust domestic demand in India contributed to local record prices.

title: Copper drifts higher, but holds below record with investors wary
summary: Copper prices rose on Tuesday but remained well below recent record highs as investors stayed cautious. The drift higher reflects ongoing market trends amid supply concerns and demand pressures.

title: Currently, high copper prices are significantly suppressing end-use
summary: Copper prices hit fresh all-time highs above $12,000 a tonne in London and $5.60 a pound in Chicago this week, capping a year of production challenges. High prices are suppressing end-use demand while highlighting persistent supply strains.

title: Alara Resources Dispatches 32nd Copper Concentrate Shipment
summary: Alara Resources announced the dispatch of its 32nd shipment of copper concentrate from the Al Wash-hi – Majaza copper-gold mine in Oman on December 30, 2025. The shipment totaled 1378.6 WMT of copper concentrate containing approximately 252.6 MT of copper and 5.3 kg of gold. The mine, operated by Alara’s joint venture Al Hadeetha Resources LLC, has maintained consistent production levels.

title: Kutcho Copper Announces Closing of Flow-Through Financing
summary: Kutcho Copper Corp closed a flow-through financing to fund exploration on its Kutcho copper-zinc property in British Columbia. The proceeds will qualify as Canadian exploration expenses to be incurred by December 31, 2026. This supports the company's development plans for the project amid risks in mineral exploration and mining.

title: Mercuria Inks Copper Concentrate Offtake Deal with Geotechmin for 2026
summary: Mercuria signed an offtake agreement with Bulgarian mining company Geotechmin for 100% of its copper concentrate production in 2026. This deal secures future supply amid ongoing base metals market dynamics. It highlights commitments in the copper concentrate sector.

title: On December 31, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
summary: The SMM #1 refined nickel price reached 132,700-142,400 yuan/mt on December 31, with an average of 137,550 yuan/mt. This marks an increase of 5,000 yuan/mt from the previous day. The price surge reflects ongoing market volatility in nickel trading.

title: Nickel Prices Soar to Phase Highs on Dec 30, 2025 Driven by Fund Flows and Supply Disruptions
summary: Nickel prices surged significantly on December 30, 2025, with the LME nickel three-month contract reaching $16,700/mt. The single-day increase exceeded 5%, hitting new phase highs driven by fund flows and supply disruptions. This momentum approached previous peaks amid non-ferrous metal market dynamics.

title: Viewpoint: Indonesia's MHP surge to hit nickel prices
summary: Argus-assessed 37pc nickel payable MHP prices fell 2.6% year-on-year to $127.40/mtu in 2025, amid Indonesia's rapid MHP capacity expansion pressuring prices. Nickel prices are expected to remain in the low-$15,000s/t range in 2026 due to supply outpacing demand, with EV market growth slowing. Global oversupply, estimated over 200,000t in 2026, contributes to weaker LME prices despite recent surges.

title: Nickel hits nine-month high
summary: Nickel prices hit a nine-month high after Indonesia announced plans to cut supply in 2026 to balance demand and boost prices. The country, producing nearly 70% of global nickel for stainless steel and EV batteries, will tighten mining quotas. Despite a weaker year due to battery demand disappointment, Indonesian output remains central to 2026 price outlook.

title: Nickel Price Surge Reaches Nine-Month High Following Indonesian Cuts
summary: Nickel prices surged to a nine-month high following signals of supply cuts from Indonesia. The move aims to address oversupply and support market prices amid global demand trends. This development highlights Indonesia's influence on nickel market dynamics.

title: Nickel prices jump to multi-month high on Indonesia supply cut signals
summary: Nickel prices on the LME surged to a multi-month high on Tuesday after Indonesia signaled supply cuts. The announcement triggered sharp gains amid ongoing supply concerns. Prices reflect expectations of tighter quotas to stabilize the market.

title: Indonesia navigates nickel market with output cuts, policy shifts
summary: Indonesia plans to cut nickel output in 2026 via production quotas to support prices and curb oversupply after royalties were raised earlier. The move follows LME prices hitting a near-five-year low and aims to ease global glut, with market share projected to rise. LME stocks surged above 250,000 mt by quarter-end.

title: Indonesia Signals Major Nickel Supply Cuts, Sending Prices Soaring
summary: LME nickel prices surged nearly 5% to a multi-month high after Indonesia signaled major supply cuts. As the dominant producer, Indonesia's policy shift addresses oversupply and boosts market sentiment. The rally underscores supply-side interventions driving recent trends.

title: [SMM Analysis] 2025 Nickel Market Recap & 2026 Outlook
summary: The analysis highlights significant growth in China's electrodeposited nickel capacity, covering domestic demand and reducing imports from 260,000 mt in 2021 to 100,000 mt in 2024, with a rebound expected to 220,000 mt in 2025. Exports are projected to reach 170,000 mt in 2025 due to cost advantages. Global inventories continue to accumulate, with LME stocks up 59% to 250,000 mt by December 22, 2025, and SHFE at 45,000 mt as of December 26.

title: Nickel hits nine-month high
summary: Nickel prices reached a nine-month high after Indonesia announced plans to reduce output in 2026 to match supply with demand and boost prices. The country, producing nearly 70% of global nickel used in stainless steel and EV batteries, will control supply via mining quotas. Despite rising supply causing LME stockpiles to increase, Indonesian production remains key to future price outlooks.

title: Indonesia navigates nickel market with output cuts, policy shifts
summary: Indonesia plans to cut nickel production in 2026 via quotas to support prices and address oversupply, following a market share increase to 60.2% in 2024. The move reverses prior quota policies and targets environmentally harmful operations amid global surpluses. Actual production lags approved capacity, but current supply exceeds demand, with forecasts predicting a market deficit by 2032.

title: Nickel Hits Nine-month High as Indonesia Plans to Cut Output
summary: Nickel prices hit a nine-month high following Indonesia's announcement to cut supply and boost prices. As the top producer, Indonesia's output reduction plans are driving the market surge.

title: Nickel prices jump to multi-month high on Indonesia supply cut signals
summary: Nickel prices on the LME surged to a multi-month high on Tuesday due to signals of supply cuts from Indonesia. The announcement has triggered a sharp market reaction.

title: Nickel Price Hits Nine-Month High on Indonesia Cuts
summary: Nickel prices surged to a nine-month high following Indonesia's planned output cuts. The policy intervention by the top producer is fueling the price rally.

title: Nickel hits nine-month high
summary: Nickel reached its highest price since March as Indonesia plans to cut supply to support prices. The top producer's move is central to market dynamics.

title: Indonesia to cut mining output quotas to support prices, minister says
summary: Indonesia will slash 2026 nickel output quotas, causing Shanghai nickel prices to rise over 3%. As the world's top producer, this aims to support prices amid oversupply.

title: Indonesia Signals Major Nickel Supply Cuts, Sending Prices Soaring
summary: LME nickel prices surged nearly 5% to a multi-month high after Indonesia signaled major supply cuts. The dominant producer's actions are propelling the price increase.

title: Future of metal and mining: Boliden launches Low-Carbon Nickel
summary: Boliden has launched Low-Carbon Nickel, expanding its Green Transition Metals portfolio with a product featuring a carbon footprint of less than 5 kg CO2eq per kg nickel equivalent, far below the global average of over 34 kg. Innovations at facilities like Kevitsa and Harjavalta save over 18 million kg of CO2 emissions yearly, enabling use in EV batteries and low-carbon power generation. This launch underscores Boliden's commitment to sustainability through life-cycle assessments and process development.

title: Will Nickel Replace Lithium? The High-Stakes Race for Next-Gen Battery Dominance
summary: Nickel is emerging as a contender to lithium in next-generation batteries, offering better performance, abundance, and reduced reliance on cobalt, which supports sustainability by lowering supply chain risks and environmental harm. Nickel-metal hydride batteries already prove durable in hybrid vehicles, with potential expansion to grid storage amid advances in nickel-rich cathodes and solid-state tech. Challenges include mining's environmental impact, addressed through eco-friendly practices and recycling.

title: Nickel Industry News, Views and Commentary - Chronickels
summary: Recent commentary highlights NOVONIX's all-dry, zero-waste cathode synthesis technology, reducing costs and environmental impact of nickel-based cathodes for batteries. Nickel-containing stainless steel supports green hydrogen production, while alloys enable cellulosic ethanol from plant waste as a fossil fuel substitute. Discussions affirm nickel's sustainability across its value chain if all stakeholders prioritize responsibility, amid growing EV battery demands.

title: Lithium, graphite, nickel… Europe relaunches its industrial strategy for critical raw materials from extraction to recycling
summary: Europe is advancing 47 strategic projects worth €22.5 billion for critical materials like nickel, focusing on extraction, processing, recycling, and substitution to bolster battery supply chains with ESG compliance. G7 partnerships aim to mobilize private capital, though challenges persist in refining sovereignty and mining acceptability. Recycling gains emphasis but primary production remains key short-term, amid social and environmental concerns.

title: EU launches material recovery rules to boost waste battery recycling
summary: The European Commission introduced rules effective July 24, 2025, mandating high material recovery from waste batteries, including 90% for nickel, cobalt, copper, and lead by 2027, rising to 95% by 2031, and 50-80% for lithium. These target securing critical raw materials for EVs and renewables, transforming batteries into resource hubs for a circular economy. The regulations cut waste and enhance resilience amid the green transition.

title: Press Release - Cogne Acciai Speciali
summary: CVA Group and Cogne Acciai Speciali have signed the first Energy Release contract in the Aosta Valley, enabling CAS to advance 272,075 MWh of electricity from 593,600 MWh expected by 2026 via four new photovoltaic plants in Sicily totaling over 20 MW. This partnership supports energy transition goals aligned with PEAR VDA 2030 and the European Green Deal, enhancing CAS's energy performance and reducing environmental impact. CVA benefits from stabilized energy sales and incentives.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has launched the pilot phase of its green hydrogen production at its Aosta plant using a 1.008 MW AEM electrolyzer capable of producing 165 tons of hydrogen annually. This will power one of its 70 furnaces fully and prevent up to 26 tons of carbon emissions per ton of hydrogen. The project, presented in 2023, is funded by €7.9 million from Italy’s NRRP.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne advances its decarbonization strategy with purchase of electrolyzer
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has achieved the first milestone in its 'Green Hydrogen in Cogne' project by acquiring an electrolyzer from Enapter to produce green hydrogen and advance decarbonization. The electrolyzer supports the company's strategy to reduce emissions in stainless steel and nickel alloy production. This step fast-tracks their sustainability efforts in the steel industry.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, northern Italy. The initiative aims to produce green hydrogen for reducing emissions in stainless and specialty steel manufacturing. This launch marks progress in the company's decarbonization efforts.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Copper Cables: Antitrust Launches Investigation into Alleged Cartel
summary: Italy's Antitrust Authority has initiated an investigation into major low-voltage copper cable manufacturers, including Prysmian Cavi e Sistemi Italia Srl and others, for alleged price-fixing since 2005. Inspections were conducted at company offices with support from the Guardia di Finanza. Prysmian shares dropped 1.26% in response, though analysts view the impact as negligible given the small market share.
